section: TERM OF CONTRACT The Term of this Agreement shall be for a period of [* ****] years and [*****] months commencing the 1st day of September 2004 and terminating the [*****] day of [*****].
explanation: The redacted portions of the contract term create ambiguity. Without knowing the exact number of years and months, or the specific termination date, it's impossible to determine the agreement's duration. This lack of clarity leads to potential disputes regarding the contract's lifespan and the parties' obligations.

section: MANDATORY PRODUCTS" shall mean the following ADAMS GOLF PRODUCTS that CONSULTANT must exclusively play/use in all Champions/Senior Professional Golf Association (SPGA) and Professional Golf Association (PGA) events at all times: [***** ] Confidential Material redacted and filed separately with the Commission. 2 1.[*****] 2.Sufficient [*****] to maintain total minimum of [*****] ADAMS GOLF [*****] (includes [*****])[*****] at all times 3.[*****] 4.[*****] (CONSULTANT may continue to place the [*****] logo on the [*****] consistent with historical practice.)
explanation: The redaction of the specific mandatory products creates an in-text contradiction. The contract mandates exclusive use of 'MANDATORY PRODUCTS,' but the definition of what constitutes these products is heavily redacted, making it impossible to determine which products the consultant is obligated to use. This creates an ambiguity in the obligation itself.

section: Notwithstanding paragraphs 4A, 4B and 4C above, CONSULTANT shall be entitled to endorse and play the [*****]. The parties expressly agree that CONSULTANT may permit [*****] the use of CONSULTANT'S name and/or likeness in [*****] print and/or television advertisement provided that this is executed in a manner consistent with [*****] past [*****] advertising practice using similarly situated professional golfers with competing golf club endorsement agreements that include [*****]. If [*****] use of CONSULTANT varies from past practice of utilizing similarly situated professionals, CONSULTANT will take action to remedy the situation [*****]. If CONSULTANT participates directly in any [*****] sponsored photo shoots for advertising or PR, CONSULTANT shall wear his ADAMS GOLF [*****]. The parties further expressly agree that CONSULTANT'S endorsement of the [*****] shall not include the right to place a [*****] logo on his ADAMS GOLF [*****] or the ADAMS GOLF [*****]. If CONSULTANT'S relationship with [*****] terminates during this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall be permitted to replace the [*****] endorsement with another [*****] endorsement under the same terms and conditions expressed herein.
explanation: This section allows the consultant to endorse and play a certain product, but the identity of that product is redacted, making the exception vague. The numerous redactions throughout the paragraph make it difficult to understand the scope and limitations of this exception to the exclusivity clause. It becomes unclear what advertising practices are considered consistent with past practices and what actions the consultant must take to remedy a situation if the use of the consultant varies from past practice.

section: Notwithstanding paragraphs 4A, 4B and 4C above, CONSULTANT shall not be required to wear ADAMS GOLF [*****] in [*****] ads.
explanation: This statement creates an ambiguity due to the redactions. It is unclear what specific item of clothing the consultant is not required to wear and in what specific type of advertisements. This lack of clarity makes it difficult to enforce the provision and understand its intended scope.

section: In each and every calendar year of this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall achieve a satisfactory record of play in a minimum of [* ****] professional golf association events on the SPGA and/or PGA tour (which shall include both the PGA and SPGA Tour Skins Games). If for any reason, CONSULTANT should achieve a satisfactory record of play in less than [*****] SPGA and/or PGA tour events in a calendar year, he shall repay ADAMS GOLF an amount per event for each event under [*****] achieved in the given calendar year as follows:
explanation: The redacted minimum number of tournaments creates an in-text contradiction. The paragraph establishes a requirement for a 'satisfactory record of play' in a minimum number of events, but the actual number is redacted, rendering the requirement unenforceable and ambiguous. The subsequent repayment clause is triggered if the consultant plays in fewer than the redacted number, but without knowing that number, the repayment obligation is unclear.

section: ADAMS GOLF must exercise its right of termination within ninety (90) days of its senior management becoming aware of the conduct giving rise to the right of termination.
explanation: There is ambiguity in text because it is not clarified as to which senior management must become aware of the conduct, and it is not clarified that this awareness must be written. This ambiguity in text is a contradiction.

section: For the entire term of this Agreement, from September 1, 2004 through [*****] ADAMS GOLF shall pay CONSULTANT a base compensation of [*****] dollars.
explanation: The redactions of both the agreement's end date and the base compensation amount introduce significant ambiguity. It's impossible to determine the total compensation due to the consultant or the exact duration for which this compensation is to be paid. This lack of clarity creates substantial uncertainty regarding the financial obligations of Adams Golf.
